sentences: Ta on n√µudnud suurt hulka infot.
Meil on vaja veel hulka aega.
context: The word 'hulka' is the partitive form of 'hulk', meaning 'amount', 'quantity', or 'number'. It's used to indicate an unspecified but large quantity of something. In Estonian, this case is commonly used with mass nouns and plural count nouns when you want to express 'a lot of' or 'many/much'.
